image.altText: A teen girl with hair over her faces looks down at the ground in a dimly lit street.

props.synopsis: After her daughter's school suggested her 9-year-old find a "secret" way to tell her teacher she was being bullied, one parent has demanded change.

title.children: Parents demand change as 9yo told to 'not be so much of a target' for bullies

image.altText: Emperor Penguin chicks walking along the edge of an ice shelf

props.synopsis: Proposed "geoengineering" projects designed to reduce the impacts of global warming in polar regions would be ineffective, extremely costly and environmentally dangerous, researchers have warned.

title.children: Polar 'geoengineering' won't fix climate warming, study finds

image.altText: David Jenkins

props.synopsis: A man was beaten and stabbed repeatedly by three men before he died, a trial in the Launceston Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Murder trial hears victim overpowered by three men

image.altText: Unidentified young female students in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Moonah, New Town and Risdon Vale primary schools in suburban and outer Hobart have volunteered to take part in a five-year trial after a visit to the UK by Education Minister Jo Palmer.

title.children: Tasmania to trial UK multi-school model for public schools

image.altText: A group of protesters shout and hold their arms aloft in front of a burning building

props.synopsis: Anti-government protests erupt into deadly violence, with Nepalese youth venting their frustration over a political system they accuse of corruption.

title.children: Nepal's capital burns as PM's resignation sparks anarchy concerns

image.altText: Alex and Vicky Ryvchin outside former Dover Heights home after it was vandalised, red paint on white wall

props.synopsis: Police charge the alleged mastermind and an accomplice who they say orchestrated and carried out a series of antisemitic attacks across Sydney this year.

title.children: Breaking: Two men charged over Sydney antisemitic incidents

image.altText: Deputy NSW Ombudsman Steve Kinmond

props.synopsis: Steve Kinmond has been removed from office after an independent investigation found he intervened in a "working with children check" while failing to declare a conflict of interest.

title.children: Head of working with children checks in NSW sacked

image.altText: NAB log on a building

props.synopsis: NAB is hiring more workers in Asia while hundreds of Australian jobs are set to be cut. The union representing affected workers has vowed to push back on the job losses, a day after ANZ flagged thousands of redundancies.

title.children: 'Two banks in two days': More bank workers face axe as NAB cuts 400 roles

image.altText: A house with a white picket fence and a for sal sign out the front.

props.synopsis: The Home Guarantee Scheme expansion will see income limits withdrawn and property price thresholds increased from October 1.

title.children: Options for first home buyers set to almost double from October

image.altText: image of two three adults and two children in a kitchen posing as for a family photoshoot.

props.synopsis: Friends Gem and Renata have saved money buying a home together with their respective families in Wollongong, and say the pay-off goes much further.

title.children: Friends combine finances to buy dream home together

image.altText: A composite image of two boys who were victims of a fatal knife attack

props.synopsis: Community leaders call for justice for 12-year-old Chol Achiek and 15-year-old Dau Akueng, who were murdered in what investigators say may have been a case of mistaken identity.

title.children: Mourners honour beloved boys killed in violent Melbourne attack

image.altText: Trump, Melania, Epstein and Maxwell pose for a photo in 2002

props.synopsis: The White House says it will support a forensic analysis of the signature on a birthday letter allegedly given by Donald Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump's alleged signature on Epstein birthday note to be analysed

image.altText: People marching for NAIDOC Rally. One lady holds a sign that reads 'Treaty Now'.

props.synopsis: For Aboriginal people, it has been centuries in the making. As Victoria tables legislation for the country's first treaty with First Nations people, Indigenous leaders are urging other states and territories to follow suit.

title.children: First Nations leaders applaud Australia's first treaty centuries in the making

image.altText: A young man in a suit surrounded by media.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal Party staffer is seeking a full and unredacted copy of a forensic download of the complainant's mobile phone, as lawyers in the case continue wrangling over documents and recordings.

title.children: Lehrmann seeks full forensic copy of Toowoomba rape accuser's phone

image.altText: Torrie Lewis looks up at the end of a race wearing green and gold

props.synopsis: For Torrie Lewis, these World Athletics Championships in Tokyo are just the beginning of a journey she hopes will take her to very top of world sprinting.

title.children: Freeman. Pearson. Lewis? The giants inspiring our next sprint superstar

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

title.children: Lachlan emerges as winner but Murdoch hold on News and Fox more vulnerable

image.altText: A silhouette of a boat seen at night time in black ocean waters, illuminated in dim purple lighting

props.synopsis: Organisers of the Global Sumud Flotilla say one of its boats was hit by a drone strike in waters off a Tunisian port, in what the group claims was the second attack on its vessels in as many days.

title.children: Flotilla for Gaza says one of its boats was hit by another drone attack

image.altText: A worker with a light on his helmet inside a dark tunnel

props.synopsis: Tunnel workers on the country's largest renewable energy project have accepted a 8.5 per cent pay increase and improvements to working conditions.

title.children: Snowy 2.0 workers get $50k pay rise after union campaign

image.altText: An ASX share market digital board listing stocks in green and red lighting alongside the ASX logo

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is on the rise, while in news out of the US, a judge has temporarily blocked Donald Trump's bid to fire a Fed governor. NAB is the latest major bank to announce significant job cuts. See how the trading day unfolds on our blog.

title.children: ASX on the rise as bank shares climb as job cuts loom

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia approves first vaccine to save koalas from chlamydia
'Two banks in two days': Union slams NAB, ANZ cuts
US judge blocks Trump from firing Fed's Lisa Cook

image.altText: Navya Nair smiles and flashes the peace sign as she sits in a business class seat on a plane.

props.synopsis: The incident involving Navya Nair highlights a common concern facing many visitors to Australia — what can be brought in without the risk of breaching strict biosecurity laws?

title.children: Visiting Indian actor fined for not declaring flowers from her dad

image.altText: a photo of a sigm

props.synopsis: About 300 people are sheltering in Mowanjum as a bushfire threatens their small Indigenous community.

title.children: 'Too late to leave' as fire threatens remote WA community

image.altText: Signage at the Reserve Bank of Australia building in Sydney

props.synopsis: While most Australians with a mortgage have been benefiting from the Reserve Bank cutting rates this year, not everyone is celebrating.

title.children: Rate cuts are good for many but savers are finding life 'more difficult'

image.altText: A piece of wood with dark trails inside.

props.synopsis: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

title.children: Australia on alert as shot-hole borer wipes out thousands of trees

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court that has been reluctant to check Donald Trump's flex of executive authority will decide in November whether to uphold lower-court rulings against his trade tariffs.

title.children: Trump's trade tariffs rush to Supreme Court

image.altText: Screenshot of police dashcam during a chase through North Sydney

props.synopsis: Police vision shows the moments after an alleged gangland assassin failed in his attempt to take out a Sydney crime boss.

title.children: Video shows alleged would-be assassin dodging traffic in dramatic getaway

image.altText: two men working on a roof wearing hivis gear

props.synopsis: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

title.children: There is a high rate of suicide in construction. Here's what to look for

image.altText: An employee examining ammunition at a factory

props.synopsis: Less than a year after its announcement, the Department of Defence quietly scraps a procurement promising to scale up production at Thales Australia's north-east Victorian facility.

title.children: Defence quietly axes new ammunition procurement with Thales Australia

image.altText: A child's hands play with nylon strings on an acoustic guitar

props.synopsis: Music and art therapists will be able to bill NDIS participants at the same rate as counsellors after a review found the therapies could be effective in the right circumstances.

title.children: NDIS call made on music and art therapy after review of evidence base

image.altText: Looking upwards in a rainforest through palms and trees.

props.synopsis: A groundbreaking study has revealed the extraordinarily rich biodiversity of Australia's islands and experts say it shows tighter controls are needed to protect the most diverse island of them all.

title.children: 'Bleak' outlook for K'gari unless visitor numbers capped, experts say

image.altText: A closeup of a ready-to-be-harvested medicinal cannabis plant.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 600 reports of "adverse events" for medicinal cannabis in the past three years, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) is yet to investigate the safety of most medicinal cannabis products. It has now launched a review.

title.children: Psychiatrists fear medicinal cannabis adverse events are 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: Reds player Massimo De Lutiis posing with a rugby ball held against his chest, in the tunnel of a stadium

props.synopsis: Australian rugby's latest chapter in a third-tier competition kicks off this weekend with high hopes that it can be a platform for future stars.

title.children: New rugby competition gives Wallabies hopefuls chance to shine

image.altText: A man warms up for a rugby league match

props.synopsis: James Fisher-Harris did more than most to help build Penrith's premiership dynasty, but if the Panthers are to continue their run, they'll have to take down the fearsome prop in Saturday's sudden-death final.

title.children: For Penrith's dynasty to survive it must destroy one of its favourite sons

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in braids takes out her mouthguard and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: The Women's Rugby World Cup, currently being held in England, is trialling a revolutionary approach to concussion management. Players are wearing LED mouthguards which light up when a player sustains a hit that could result in a concussion.

title.children: How flashing mouthguards are being used to combat sport's biggest problem

image.altText: A tiny lamb the size of a farmer's boot, wearing a pastel tartan woollen coat in paddock with normal lambs towering over him.

props.synopsis: The tiny lamb that captured the hearts of Australians during COVID has died, leaving a heartbroken family behind.

title.children: Tiny lamb that became an internet sensation during COVID dies
